hook.text: A top performer heard she needed to improve her communication. She spiraled: maybe I'm a fraud.

buildup.text: When feedback threatens our self-image, we hear you're not good enough instead of here's how to grow.

discovery.text: Stone and Heen: people with growth mindsets absorb feedback better because it doesn't threaten identity.

twist.text: Feedback is about behavior, not who you are. Separating identity from action is the key skill.

climax.text: Remind yourself: this is about what I did, not who I am. I can change what I do.

punchline.text: You are not your last mistake. You can always adjust.

quiz.question: Why does feedback sometimes feel like a personal attack?
options: It threatens our self-image when we can't separate identity from behavior
All feedback is inherently designed to make people feel bad
Only people with low self-esteem struggle with feedback
